name: pH and conductivity
functionStatement: Physical and chemical processes limit pollutants, retain beneficial constituents, and protect ecological and human uses.
descriptionMarkdown: Values near ~6.5-8.5/local norms, no extreme shift unless naturally acidic (bog) or alkaline (arid).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Take handheld measurements for pH and specific conductance and compare to local expectations.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: pH about 6.5-8.5 and conductance within typical range.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Slightly off-range or mild conductance elevation.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Extreme pH or very high conductance indicating major stress.

references: USGS NWIS and/or EPA Water Quality Portal (pH and specific conductance where available).
